title: Baichuan-Audio: A Unified Framework for End-to-End Speech Interaction
author: Tianpeng Li (Baichuan Inc.), Jun Liu (Baichuan Inc.), Tao Zhang (Baichuan Inc.), Yuanbo Fang (Baichuan Inc.), Da Pan (Baichuan Inc.), Mingrui Wang (Baichuan Inc.), Zheng Liang (Baichuan Inc.), ..., Weipeng Chen (Baichuan Inc.)
relevance_why: The proposed Baichuan-Audio model significantly enhances speech interaction systems, which aligns closely with Haohe Liu's research interests in audio, speech, and related technologies. Its approach to integrating text and audio modalities can inform and improve methodologies in audio-language alignment and processing.
background: The paper presents a model that enables seamless end-to-end interaction by integrating audio understanding and generation, allowing for real-time speech communication.
contribution: Baichuan-Audio introduces a novel architecture that fuses audio comprehension and generation, achieving improved real-time performance in speech interaction.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous models in speech interaction relied on cascade processes that introduced latency and error accumulation through multiple conversions (e.g., ASR to text, then TTS).
technical_comparison.novelty: This work replaces the traditional cascade approach with an end-to-end model that simultaneously processes audio and text, significantly reducing delays and enhancing accuracy.

key_innovation: Utilizes a two-stage pre-training strategy for audio modeling while preserving language capabilities, enabling high-quality bilingual conversations.
real_world_impact: The model enhances the effectiveness of voice-based applications in real-time dialogue, making it practical for integration into systems like virtual assistants, customer service bots, and interactive learning platforms.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.multi-codebook discretization: **Multi-codebook discretization** is a technique used to convert audio signals into discrete tokens, retaining both semantic and acoustic information, which aids in effective audio processing.
new_terms.flow-matching decoder: **Flow-matching decoder** refers to a type of audio synthesis model that improves the quality of audio output by optimizing the reconstruction of Mel spectrograms through flow-based techniques.

open_sourcing: The code, model, and training data are available at https://github.com/baichuan-inc/Baichuan-Audio
